intro: Pilocereus guerreronis, commonly known as the Guerrerón cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are covered in dense, white spines. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring minimal water and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and blooming habits, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
